issue.title: Production Module Calculation Issue: Programming Error or Misunderstanding?
issue.body:
Hello All

I'd like to discuss an issue I can't seem to understand in the manufacturing module.

Is this a programming error or a misunderstanding on my part?

After creating the bill of materials, I create a new manufacturing order, assuming I want to produce 1000 units of the product.

According to the bill of materials, the system calculates the production requirements for these 1000 units.

Then, we get to the production stage.

At this point, the system offers me two options:

CONSUME AND PRODUCE ALL: When I choose this option, the consumption process for the 1000 units is completed, consumptions are calculated, and stock movements are adjusted accurately.

CONSUME OR PRODUCE: To my understanding, this is partial production (meaning I don't produce the 1000 units completely, but I can choose to produce, for example, 500 units).

Here, I have to manually enter consumption quantities. Why doesn't the system automatically calculate consumption when I input the quantity I want to produce based on the associated bill of materials?

Furthermore, in this option, if I have more material in stock than what is actually required for production, the system accepts the higher quantity and deducts it. Where is the logic in this?

If I only need 1000 units and, for instance, I have 2000 of a certain material in stock, the system should reject this, but it doesn't.

Similarly, if I require 1000 units only and I enter 2000 in the CONSUME OR PRODUCE field, the system still accepts this quantity, even though the manufacturing order is for 1000 units only.

Is this a system bug or a misunderstanding on my part of the production process?

comment.body:
@sara30789 This is definitely normal! @eldy already gives a good scenario where counting your consumed quantities only occurs at the end of production rather than per unit produced. It's certainly true that in some production you have a directly 1:1 on your BOM and the output, such as a scenario where you have a gift box with three items in it, and it's always those three items and an outer box which makes up the item. This seems to be what you are thinking of.

However some items are produced using variable quantities. Dolibarr doesn't use stock quantity units (yet) so you can't have stock listed in metres, litres, or kilos, so you may not have thought of this. Imagine a production of drinks, where you mix five liquids. What happens if you spill some? What happens if you use a little more of one liquid than usual? In food science especially, you often have to vary the quantities depending on the quality or potency of the ingredients at the time, which can vary from yield to yield, season to season. It's complex.

Now I doubt many people are using Dolibarr at this level, but take a simpler example: You make dolls out of fabric, cotton string and stuffing. You know you usually need a certain amount of fabric off a roll, but as you cut your shapes out of the fabric you may need more or less depending on how well you can fit the shapes from the fabric. It's an uncertainty that needs to be accounted for.

I've worked on a number of very large ERP systems for multinationals for decades and Dolibarr's implementation of production is very simplistic in comparison, but that's a okay. Dolibarr doesn't account for other types of consumption such as waste, yield, quality, and other parameters (yet), which really only interest larger companies who are analysing their production metrics heavily, but the use cases for the production module are quite broad and varied.

Maybe this is a topic better suited as an improvement for Dolibarr documentation.

issue.title: Feature Request - Quarantine warehouse
issue.body:
### Feature Request

It would be useful to be able to mark a warehouse as a quarantine warehouse. This would allow stock to be recorded in inventory but be unavailable for order, without having to implement stock lotting and inventory quality recording.

A quarantine warehouse should function exactly the same as a normal warehouse, only with a boolean flag "Quarantine" set to "true" which indicates that this stock is not to be proposed on a sales order when preparing a shipment.

### Use case

Dolibarr doesn't have any quality control processes, which makes rigidly implementing GxP difficult, but not impossible.

Helpful would be the ability to control the quality of the stock. At the very least, damaged stock or returned stock should be in a quarantined status pending a quality control. To do this simply, stock can enter a quarantine warehouse where it is isolated from the main stock and cannot be sold by accident.

Implementing a quarantine warehouse is a simple but very effective way of adding a small level quality control.

### **Scenario 1:**
 - Customer returns an item they no longer want
 - Item should be returned to stock in the quarantine warehouse pending examination to answer if it can be resold, and if it can be resold as what quality (New/A-stock, Damaged/Used/B-stock, etc.)
 - If the item can be resold, it can be moved to a main warehouse

### **Scenario 2:**
 - Items have been damaged in the warehouse, i.e. water damage
 - Items should be then moved to the quarantine warehouse pending a quality examination and decision to destroy, gift, rework, repurpose, etc.

### **Scenario 3:**
 - Items have expired
 - To avoid accidentally shipping, items should be moved to a quarantine space pending destruction, donation, etc.

### Suggested implementation

The simplest implemention is as follows:

1. An additional "warehouse type" is added to the "Warehouse" settings with the possibility for two values, "Normal" (existing behaviour) and "Quarantine" (modified behavior)
2. When creating an order shipment, any stock in a warehouse marked as "quarantine" is not considered as available
3. Optional: If an order shipment contains a line with the warehouse set to a quarantine warehouse, display a warning that stock is emanating from a quarantine warehouse.

### Suggested steps

1. Add a "warehouse type" field to the warehouse record (`llx_entrepot`) of integer type with values `0` = "Normal" and `1` = "Quarantine" (maybe this can be extended in future with 'transit', but that's a user story for another day)
3. Adjust logic when creating a shipment on a sales order that stock in a quarantine warehouse is not considered as available for sale - i.e. adjust the query that checks for stock to exclude stock in a warehouse that is marked as quarantine (type = `1`)
4. Optional: If a shipment is made with a quantity from a quarantine warehouse, adjust the order shipment page to display a warning that stock is emanating from a quarantine warehouse.

issue.title: Feature Request - Multicurrency on VAT payments
issue.body:
### Feature Request

Allow multicurrency on sales tax (VAT) payments, to support cross-border sales tax obligations in other currencies.

### Use case

When selling in multiple countries, selling over a certain threshold or if a 3PL warehouse solution is used with stock in that foreign country, it would be necessary to be tax/VAT registered in that country.

The situation arises that if you have to declare and pay VAT in another country where the currency is different, this cannot be directly accounted for in the sales tax payments.

For example, your company is in France, and you pay French VAT in Euros (EUR), but you also have a warehouse in Sweden and sell from Sweden, therefore you also pay Swedish VAT in Swedish Krona (SEK).

Currently it's only possible to correctly account for this if you pay your French VAT in EUR from a EUR bank account, and Swedish VAT in SEK from a SEK bank account. This all falls apart if you need to pay your Swedish VAT amount in SEK from a EUR bank account, because there is no multicurrency option.

Note: It is necessary to record the actual sales tax paid in the currency of the declaration, so in this scenario booking only the EUR paid amount instead of the real SEK amount is not acceptable.

### Suggested implementation

1. Add the currency (and exchange rate) of the tax payment to the sales tax page - default this to the company currency for simplicity.
2. If the payment bank account is in a different currency to the VAT tax amount, allow the possibility to record the realised amount (in the bank's currency) so the bank record is accurate.

### Suggested steps

This change involves modifying not only the UI but also the `llx_tva` and `llx_payment_vat` tables to extend with multicurrency extensions (i.e. multicurrency code, multicurrency rate, multicurrency amount, ...).

A data migration script will be necessary to update the multicurrency amount for existing transactions so they match the company currency amount (exchange rate of 1.0).

issue.title: New: add hooks to apply cash discount agreements

labels.name: Discussion
labels.description: Some questions or discussions are opened and wait answers of author or other people to be processed

issue.body:
The remaining amount of an invoice to be paid can depend on a cash discount agreement. I.e. if the invoice gets paid within a certain timeframe which is shorter than the due date, an agreed percentage can be deducted from the invoice total. This is known as cash discount or escompte in FR or Skonto in DE. E.g. due date is 30 days from invoice date, but if it gets paid within 7 days, 3% can be deducted from the total.

The added hooks allow to add cash discount handling in a separate module for countries, where this applies.

comment.body:
Hi Francis, yes, I know this feature. But companies that process many invoices need more support from their ERP-system:

For instance: If I enter a payment for an invoice, the invoice gets auto-closed. With Skonto it remains in the partially paid state until someone closes it manually using the feature you mentioned.

Also entering payments is more cumbersome. The full amount can get entered with the click of a symbol. Amounts with Skonto deducted need to be entered manually etc. That's why I developed a dedicated module for a customer to assist with these things. Just a screenshot as an example: The  reduced amount can now also be entered with a click on the symbol (the one on the right side, also clearly showing the conditions). It still needs some manual choices, since companies need to be flexible with time limits and rounding "errors", i.e. larger customers sometimes stretch the rules a bit and need to get through with it. 

And even more important: With this module, the invoice gets also auto-closed like with full payments.

![image](https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/assets/10772984/c4e7f963-cba2-447c-a180-e13356845542)

It's just that in some areas, this support is still missing (direct debit payments, some mass actions etc.) and I try to find the best way.

issue.title: we can't disable $conf->global->MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: This is a bug (something does not work as expected)

issue.body:
### Bug

Basically, this is the test performed in master.inc.php (i.e. each time a Dolibarr page is loaded):

    if ($mysoc->country_code == 'FR' && !isset($conf->global->MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS)) {
        // For FR, default value of option to show profid SIRET is on by default
        $conf->global->MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS = 1;
    }

The problem is in admin/pdf.php  that when you deactivate a conf with ajax on off ( e MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS ), it deletes the element from the table and doesn't set it to 0, so the !isset test is true even though you've forced the value to 0.

What corrective action should be taken? Make ajax contantonoff.php set const to 0 instead of del ?

### Environment Version

17

### Environment OS

_No response_

### Environment Web server

_No response_

### Environment PHP

7.4

### Environment Database

_No response_

### Environment URL(s)

_No response_

### Expected and actual behavior

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

Try to disable MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS in admin/pdf.php and reload page to see the conf is still enable

### Attached files

_No response_

comment.body:
Defaut behaviour is to not have a constant defined when value is 0 into llx_const, it works for 99% of cases so we must NOT change the ajaxconstinoff and find a solution keeping this rule.

For compatibility purpose, when we introduced the option, we add a test to !isset for france so for old instance when option not defined, the option is automatically set. I think we must remove this completely the special case, to force to 1 the option for france.
So what rule is the option on or off.
And to have option on fornfrance automatically, instead i suggest to set the value to 1 when we set the country to fr into the setup of company. So if user set fr, with no knowledge, the option is correctly set by default, but if user whant to change after, it remains possible.

issue.title: MRP (GPAO) evolution in standard Dolibarr
issue.body:
# Feature Request
In order to improve the management of computer-aided production within Dolibarr, ATM proposes to implement the following elements and push them to the community. This work was carried out in consultation with various community stakeholders. Your comments are welcome.

Link to the Dolibarr french forum of the feature : [https://www.dolibarr.fr/forum/t/evolution-gpao-dans-le-coeur-dolibarr/38644](https://www.dolibarr.fr/forum/t/evolution-gpao-dans-le-coeur-dolibarr/38644)
 
## Suggested steps
**BILLS OF MATERIAL MODULE - BOM (NOMENCLATURES)**
The BOM module will be changed as follows :

- Modification of the module name from “BOM” to “MBOM / SBOM (Manufacturing Bills Of Material / Service Bills Of Matérial)” 
- The “BOM” tab will be changed as follows:
  - The tab should be renamed “MBOM” (“Nomenclature de produits”)
  - Allow only products and no longer services to be added to this table. Indeed, services do not have the same characteristics and some information in the table does not make sense for services.
  - Allow to add other MBOMs and visualize the sub-levels (the first sub-level only here to prevent performance issues).
![MBOM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57494317/146782653-a8dd9458-5c2d-422c-ab2c-dad59098d7f2.png)
- A new tab “SBOM” should be create and should offer :
  - A table allowing the addition of services from the Dolibarr catalog. It should be possible for each service to define:
    - the unit (hours, days, etc.).
    - the quantity
    - a default workstation from the “Workstation” module if activated (optional).
  - It will be possible to order the different services in the desired order.
  - The description of the service (on the service card) will make it possible to write the operating protocol. This description will be editable on the SBOM form locally.
![SBOM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57494317/146783281-b990d415-4205-481f-a530-7f15c78a0cc7.png)
  - In a second phase : addition of a "Complete tree" tab should be added to view the complete tree structure of the MBOM down to the lowest level of components as well as the quantities (view inspired by the tags / categories view). This tab should offer:
    - a "Group by product" button allowing to no longer display the tree structure but to group this list by product, each product line displaying the total quantity required for the MBOM.
    - a "Display tree" button allowing to return to the tree view.

**“PROCESS” MODULE**
A new “Process” module should be created and should add a new “Process” tab on the “MBOM / SBOM” sheets offering the following functionalities:
- A “Add a step” button allowing to create a step by choosing:
  - The step number
  - A unique service among the services from the SBOM tab
  - One or more products from the MBOM tab and a quantity for each product

- Once the step added, it should be visible in a table summarizing all the information entered on the step as illustrated below:
![Process](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57494317/146783335-59616eec-8772-44e7-994c-9f052f8451b7.png)
- Possibility of ordering these steps in the desired order.
- Possibility of parallelizing several steps by assigning the same step number to two different steps.
- A “Create OF” button should allow to create a production order from this tab.
- It should be possible to edit a PDF document allowing to view all the steps with for each:
  - The number of the step
  - The reference and the label of the service
  - The workstation if defined as well as the resources and user groups defined on the workstation
  - The reference, label, and description of the product(s) and their quantities

comment.body:
Hello, 

Any news about the evolution of the GPAO module ?

issue.title: New: add hooks to apply cash discount agreements

labels.name: Discussion
labels.description: Some questions or discussions are opened and wait answers of author or other people to be processed

issue.body:
The remaining amount of an invoice to be paid can depend on a cash discount agreement. I.e. if the invoice gets paid within a certain timeframe which is shorter than the due date, an agreed percentage can be deducted from the invoice total. This is known as cash discount or escompte in FR or Skonto in DE. E.g. due date is 30 days from invoice date, but if it gets paid within 7 days, 3% can be deducted from the total.

The added hooks allow to add cash discount handling in a separate module for countries, where this applies.

comment.body:
Thanks for chiming in. I am still checking about the best way forward.

What I am trying to address here is the "time variable" end amount of the invoice: At least in Germany and in Austria it is a common business practice to agree an a "Skonto" while closing a deal. The Skonto agreement describes that if the invoice is paid within an agreed number of days after issuing, an agreed percentage gets deducted from the total amount of the  invoice. I am not 100% sure about the details, but I think something like this exists in France as well.

From a legal/tax perspective this acts as a "time variable" total amount **and** VAT amount of the invoice. There is no need to state any discounted amount on the invoice, except for the generic Skonto agreement as part of the payment terms (e.g. printed on the invoice: payable net within 14 days, 3% Skonto if paid within 5 days). And **this does indeed affect the total_tva, but not the printed amount**: VAT owed to the tax authorities is automatically by the agreed Skonto percentage lower than the one printed on the invoice. 

I will check, if this could be achieved by using a hook within $this->invoice->getSumCreditNotesUsed(); but it must be avoided that the Skonto discount is affecting the final, printed total amount and VAT amount, because it must be stated on the invoice without the Skonto-deductions.

With the existing hooks, it was already achievable to create a Skonto-Module for most scenarios. What is currently missing are just some places/mass actions, but I will see how to address these best.

issue.title: New: add hooks to apply cash discount agreements

labels.name: Discussion
labels.description: Some questions or discussions are opened and wait answers of author or other people to be processed

issue.body:
The remaining amount of an invoice to be paid can depend on a cash discount agreement. I.e. if the invoice gets paid within a certain timeframe which is shorter than the due date, an agreed percentage can be deducted from the invoice total. This is known as cash discount or escompte in FR or Skonto in DE. E.g. due date is 30 days from invoice date, but if it gets paid within 7 days, 3% can be deducted from the total.

The added hooks allow to add cash discount handling in a separate module for countries, where this applies.

comment.body:
I agree that one of these `getSommePaiement`, `getSumCreditNotesUsed` or `getSumDepositsUsed` should be modified instead of adding hooks to all pages that call the functions.

Perhaps even a 4th function that allows to add discounts to the payment without modifying `total_ht`, `total_tva` and `total_ttc` for accounting. For cases when there's some kind of government aid where they pay a part of the total invoice, so the seller get's the full amount and the client is paying less (These aids usually end up in a specific accounting account).

And while doing this someone might consider checking https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/issues/26153

pull_request.title: Workflow: code quality with early return
pull_request.body:
# Qual Workflow: use early return to simplify code

Reduce the level of indentation in the Workflow code by using early return when possible.
Some conditions with early return were already present but some location weren't using it despite being really nested between loops and conditions.

No functional changes should be expected from those.

issue.title: we can't disable $conf->global->MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: This is a bug (something does not work as expected)

issue.body:
### Bug

Basically, this is the test performed in master.inc.php (i.e. each time a Dolibarr page is loaded):

    if ($mysoc->country_code == 'FR' && !isset($conf->global->MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS)) {
        // For FR, default value of option to show profid SIRET is on by default
        $conf->global->MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS = 1;
    }

The problem is in admin/pdf.php  that when you deactivate a conf with ajax on off ( e MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS ), it deletes the element from the table and doesn't set it to 0, so the !isset test is true even though you've forced the value to 0.

What corrective action should be taken? Make ajax contantonoff.php set const to 0 instead of del ?

### Environment Version

17

### Environment OS

_No response_

### Environment Web server

_No response_

### Environment PHP

7.4

### Environment Database

_No response_

### Environment URL(s)

_No response_

### Expected and actual behavior

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

Try to disable MAIN_PROFID1_IN_ADDRESS in admin/pdf.php and reload page to see the conf is still enable

### Attached files

_No response_
